title: Arie Vermeer
text:
Arie Vermeer (17 July 192216 December 2013) was a Dutch <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player.
Club career.
Vermeer made his debut for <a href="S.B.V.%20Excelsior">Excelsior</a> on 4 October 1942 against Neptunus and played 278 matches in 13 seasons for the club. Honours include promotion to the former Dutch Eerste Klasse in 1946 and 1952.
International career.
Vermeer earned his one and only cap for the <a href="Netherlands%20national%20football%20team">Netherlands</a> in a November 1946 <a href="friendly%20match">friendly match</a> against <a href="England%20national%20football%20team">England</a>. He is one of only 4 Excelsior players to play for the Netherlands.
Retirement and death.
During and after his football career, he owned a butcher shop in Rotterdam for 60 years. He died after a short illness on 16 December 2013.
